body.p: Tuesday come up to Tomah from Dells to give Indian News to newspaper and all people every place tell me want to have things I say about what Indians doing and like that in newspaper every week and Indian News first thing they read every time. If people want to see big ceremonial at Stand Rick where I work and part of program better come pretty soon because we only have three more weeks and them everything close up till summer come next year. Scott Mokey’s wife she been pretty sick for long time now and sometime awful bad but now she get better and pretty soon maybe be all o.k. again and that about all people that get sick form Tomah at Wisconsin Dells this summer and everybody else all feet pretty good. Hilda Smoke go to Tomah High School and finish school and everybody know her and three weeks ago she have operation at Indian hospital and get out of hospital about a week ago and all well again now. Indians that go to Indian hospital see Dr. Winter and people that work there and every time tell about get good care and pretty near every time get well too. Indian reporter make joke in paper one time when tell about go to hospital and just have glass rod put under my tongue and people don’t know I mean joke and get pretty sore and next time I make joke maybe I better tell like this “now folks this is joke and Indian reporter don’t want nobody to get mad at joke” and just want to make people have laugh about it. Philip Decorah little boy, been pretty sick too at Dells park and they take him to hospital at Tomah and he stay thee two three weeks but they tell Indian reporter that he come back to Dells Park and feel pretty good too and maybe be all right again now. Art Decorah go to Mauston one night this week and wrestle at fair grounds at Mauston. September 15 Indians start to hand pick cranberries on Valley marsh and some going to rake too. Ben Cady is boss on cranberry marsh and he is good fellow and all Indians like to work for him. Ben Cady tell Indian reporter berry crop is going to be good and have lots of berries this fall and this helps Indian people too and helps them to get money to buy things to eat in winter time. Pretty soon I come back to Tomah to live and then I can write news about people everybody know and like I been at Wisconsin Dells people that I know about and can tell in Indian News nobody that reads paper knows and not very good news like I write when I stay here. .
